You can probably solve the problem by uncommenting "GRUB_TERMINAL=console" in /etc/default/grub, but I wonder why it isn't working by default.
Are you sure that's the grub menu? In Ubuntu the grub menu isn't shown by default (only if you have another OS installed or you hold shift).
Ok, then that's not a grub issue (at least not likely)

If startupmanager changed the tty resolution that might be what caused the problem, by default grub passes a value that works with all BIOSs. If you set a higher one your BIOS may or may not support it.
